question: What are the names of disaster projects starting later than 2022?
searched_docs:
(cid:190) Project Description: This project consists of design and construction of a
few storm drains on Clover Heights.

An extended storm
drain towards the end of Clover Heights will help eliminate this issue.

The existing storm drain facility ends at
the intersection of Clover Heights and Harvester Road.

Disaster Projects (Not Started)
Clover Heights Storm Drain (FEMA Project)

Agenda Item # 4.A.

(cid:190) Estimated Schedule:

(cid:131) Complete Design: Winter 2021

Storm Drain Master Plan (FEMA Project)

(cid:190) Project Description: This project will be funded through a grant from FEMA
after the Woolsey Fire.

The City will create a complete inventory of storm
drains, culverts, debris basins, manholes, and other drainage structures
within the City.

(cid:190) Project Description: This project consists of repairing damage storm drain
facilities and roadway embankments that were damaged by the Woolsey
Fire.

During storms, this
intersection floods and causes debris to block the road.

(cid:190) Estimated Schedule:

(cid:131) Complete Design: Winter 2021
(cid:131) Begin Construction: Spring 2022

Encinal Canyon Road Drainage Improvements (FEMA/CalOES Project)

Corral Canyon Culvert Repairs (FEMA/CalOES Project)

(cid:190) Project Description: This project consisted of replacing a portion of Corral

Canyon Road that was damaged from a failed storm drain.

(cid:131) Begin Construction: Winter 2021

Agenda Item # 4.A.

Corral Canyon Road Bridge Repairs (FEMA/CalOES Project)

(cid:190) Project Description: This project consisted of replacing fire damaged
existing fencing and repairing the damaged embankment adjacent to the
bridge.

The City will
apply for future grant funding for this phase of the project. (cid:190) Upates:

2021 Annual Street Maintenance

(cid:190) Updates: This project included resurfacing Malibu Road, Broad Beach Road,
Latigo Canyon Road, Corral Canyon Road, Webb Way, Rambla Pacifico
Street and Vista Pacifica with a slurry seal treatment and adding speed
humps to Birdview Avenue.

Outdoor Warning Sirens (FEMA Project)

(cid:190) Updates: This project will be funded through a grant from FEMA after the

timber with non-combustible materials.

the Emergency Warning Sirens project will be implementation of the design
